**Wikipedia summary**:  
The <b>Dungeness crab</b> (<i><b>Metacarcinus magister</b></i>) is a species of crab inhabiting eelgrass beds and water bottoms along the west coast of North America. It typically grows to 20&#160;cm (7.9&#160;in) across the carapace and is a popular seafood. Its common name comes from Dungeness Spit, United States, which shelters a shallow bay inhabited by the crabs.</p>
